title: Authors and Citation
text: Gohel D, Ross N (2025). officedown: Enhanced 'R Markdown' Format 'Word' 'PowerPoint'. R package version 0.4.1, https://ardata-fr.github.io/officeverse/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {officedown: Enhanced 'R Markdown' Format for 'Word' and 'PowerPoint'},   author = {David Gohel and Noam Ross},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.4.1},   url = {https://ardata-fr.github.io/officeverse/}, }

title: Enhanced R Markdown Format for Word and PowerPoint
text: package facilitates formatting Microsoft Word documents produced R Markdown documents providing range features:  Compatibility functions package officer production “runs” “blocks” content (text formatting, landscape mode, tables contents, etc.). can add column break two-column section, can easily color chunk text, can add tables contents place document also add list figures list tables. Ability use table styles list styles defined “reference_docx” serves template pandoc document. rmarkdown, can reuse paragraph styles. officedown, can also reuse table list styles. features based use Word templates (reference_docx). recommended learn “Word styles” work paragraphs, tables lists never really used Word styles. styles defined Word document serves template. must first create Word document (edit existing Word document), adjust styles save . document serves vehicle defined styles used R Markdown, argument reference_docx must filled file path. replacement captions (tables, figures standard identifiers) captions containing Word bookmark can used cross-referencing. Also replacement cross-references cross-references using fields calculated Word. syntax conforms bookdown cross-reference definition. package transforms specific knitr codes references calculated Word, applies : cross-references bookdown syntax table image captions title identifiers easy copy paste content another document without losing reference numbers. Captions also auto-numbered Word. Full support flextable output, including outputs containing images links. package enable knitting flextable outputs images plots cells without using officer. Insertion images flextable supported rmarkdown::word_document possible using officedown::rdocx_document.

title: Enhanced R Markdown Format for Word and PowerPoint
text: package also enhances PowerPoint productions R Markdown providing mechanism placing results according slide template contained PowerPoint document used “reference_doc”. becomes easy add several contents slide. package also offers possibility transform graphic instructions editable vector graphics (rvg package) simply wrapping call call function dml.

title: Enhanced R Markdown Format for Word and PowerPoint
text: help pages bookdown located : https://ardata-fr.github.io/officeverse/ Manuals available : https://davidgohel.github.io/officedown/.

title: Enhanced R Markdown Format for Word and PowerPoint
text: can install officedown github : Supported formats require minimum pandoc versions:

title: Enhanced R Markdown Format for Word and PowerPoint
text: use RStudio Menu create document officedown template.  creates R markdown document, parameter output set officedown::rdocx_document. Note package officedown need loaded Rmd.

title: Enhanced R Markdown Format for Word and PowerPoint
text: bookdown available package can used demo. see following document:
code: dir <- system.file(package = "officedown", "examples", "bookdown") file.copy(dir, getwd(), recursive = TRUE, overwrite = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE # rmarkdown::render_site("bookdown") fs::dir_tree("bookdown", recurse = TRUE) #> bookdown #> ├── 01-intro.Rmd #> ├── 02-toc.Rmd #> ├── 03-tables.Rmd #> ├── 04-sections.Rmd #> ├── 05-plots.Rmd #> ├── _bookdown.yml #> ├── _output.yml #> ├── bookdown.Rproj #> ├── index.Rmd #> └── template.docx

what: Force Block Printing while Knitting — knit_print_block
title: Force Block Printing while Knitting — knit_print_block
text: used loop, calls blocks generate output knit_print method called. Use function force printing. Also tell chunk use results '-' (adding results='asis' chunk header).

title: Force Block Printing while Knitting — knit_print_block
Force Block Printing while Knitting — knit_print_block
text: x block object, result block function officer package ... unused arguments

title: Force Block Printing while Knitting — knit_print_block
text: None. function print XML code.

title: Force Block Printing while Knitting — knit_print_block
code: library(rmarkdown) rmd_file_src <- system.file(   package = "officedown", "examples", "word_loop.Rmd") rmd_file_des <- tempfile(fileext = ".Rmd") if(pandoc_available()){    file.copy(rmd_file_src, to = rmd_file_des)   docx_file_1 <- tempfile(fileext = ".docx")   render(rmd_file_des, output_file = docx_file_1, quiet = TRUE)    if(file.exists(docx_file_1)){     message("file ", docx_file_1, " has been written.")   } } #> file /tmp/RtmpNiKGlz/file1fc21c35ad73.docx has been written.

what: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: 'R Markdown' Format converting 'R Markdown' document MS Word document. function enhances output offered rmarkdown::word_document() advanced formatting features.

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
code: rdocx_document(   base_format = "rmarkdown::word_document",   tables = list(),   plots = list(),   lists = list(),   mapstyles = list(),   page_size = NULL,   page_margins = NULL,   reference_num = TRUE,   ... )

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: base_format scalar character, format used base document 'officedown'. Default word_document can also word_document2() bookdown. base_format used bookdown::word_document2, number_sections parameter automatically set FALSE. Indeed, want numbered titles, asked use Word document template auto-numbered titles (title styles default `rdocx_document' template already set FALSE). tables see section 'Tables' . plots see section 'Plots' . lists see section 'Lists' . mapstyles named list style replaced generated document. list("Normal" = c("Author", "Date")) result document paragraphs styled stylename "Date" "Author" styled stylename "Normal". page_size, page_margins default page margins dimensions. null (default), values used define default Word section. See officer::page_size() officer::page_mar(). reference_num TRUE, text references sections section number (e.g. '3.2'). FALSE, text references sections text (e.g. 'section title'). ... arguments used word_document

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: R Markdown output format pass render.

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: list can contain items style tables table captions. Missing items replaced default values. Possible items following: style: Word stylename use tables. layout: 'autofit' 'fixed' algorithm. See table_layout. width: value preferred width table percent (base 1). topcaption: caption appear (top ) table, tab.lp: caption table sequence identifier. table captions supposed identifier. makes possible insert list tables. also used prefix 'bookdown' cross-reference call; tab.lp set "tab:", cross-reference table id "xxxxx" written \@ref(tab:xxxxx). possible set value default Word value (French example "Tableau", German "Tabelle"), can add manually list tables (go "References" tab select menu "Insert Table Figures"). caption; caption options, .e.: style: Word stylename use table captions. pre: prefix numbering chunk (default "Table "). sep: suffix numbering chunk (default ": "). tnd: (applies positive. )Inserts number last title level tnd (.e. 4.3-2 figure 2 chapter 4.3). tns: separator use title number table number. Default "-". fp_text: text formatting properties apply caption prefix - see officer::fp_text_lite(). conditional: list named logical values: first_row last_row: apply remove formatting first last row table first_column  last_column: apply remove formatting first last column table no_hband no_vband: display odd even rows columns alternating shading ease reading. Default value (YAML format):
code: style: Table layout: autofit width: 1.0 topcaption: true tab.lp: 'tab:' caption:   style: Table Caption   pre: 'Table'   sep: ':'   tnd: 0   tns: '-'   fp_text: !expr officer::fp_text_lite(bold = TRUE) conditional:   first_row: true   first_column: false   last_row: false   last_column: false   no_hband: false   no_vband: true

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: Argument plot expected list. can contain items style figures figure captions. provide values items list, missing items replaced default values. Possible items : style: name "Word" paragraph style use paragraphs contain graphic. align: alignment paragraphs containing graphics (possible values 'left', 'right' 'center'). topcaption: specify whether legend appear graphic (TRUE) graphic (FALSE). fig.lp: Sequence identifier figure legends. graphics' captions supposed identifier. value used different features: used insert table figures. also used prefix 'bookdown' cross-reference call; fig.lp set "fig:", cross-reference figure id "xxxxx" written \@ref(fig:xxxxx). possible set Word default value (French example, "Figure"), can manually add list figures (go "References" tab select "Insert table figures" menu). caption: list captions' options, .e. style: name "Word" paragraph style use paragraphs contain figures' captions. pre: prefix numbering chunk (default "Figure "). sep: suffix numbering chunk (default ": "). tnd: (applies positive). Inserts number last title level tnd (.e. 4.3-2 figure 2 chapter 4.3). tns: separator use title number figure number. Default "-". fp_text: text formatting properties apply caption prefix - see officer::fp_text_lite(). Default value (YAML format):
code: style: Normal align: center topcaption: false fig.lp: 'fig:' caption:   style: Image Caption   pre: 'Figure '   sep: ': '   tnd: 0   tns: '-'   fp_text: !expr officer::fp_text_lite(bold = TRUE)

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: parameter lists list can contain two named items: ol.style: style use ordered lists. ul.style: style use unordered lists. Default values list(ol.style = NULL, ul.style = NULL). Expected values stylenames used replace style ordered unordered lists created pandoc. NULL, replacement made. values YAML format :   can values corresponding existing stylenames (type 'numbering'). package 'officer', can read values styles_info().   available values, possible configuration possible:
code: output:   officedown::rdocx_document:     lists:       ol.style: null       ul.style: null library(officer) docx_file <- system.file(   package = "officedown", "examples",   "bookdown", "template.docx" ) doc <- read_docx(docx_file) styles_info(doc, type = "numbering")[, 1:6] #>    style_type    style_id style_name     base_on is_custom is_default #> 13  numbering Aucuneliste    No List        <NA>     FALSE       TRUE #> 40  numbering   Defaultul Default ul Aucuneliste      TRUE      FALSE #> 41  numbering   Defaultol Default ol Aucuneliste      TRUE      FALSE output:   officedown::rdocx_document:     lists:       ol.style: 'Default ol'       ul.style: 'Default ul'

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: can access Word template used. Function styles_info() can let read styles. need 'officer' read stylenames (get information specific "reference_docx", change ref_docx_default example .   read paragraph stylenames:   read table stylenames:   read list stylenames:
code: library(officer) docx_file <- system.file(package = "officer", "template", "template.docx") doc <- read_docx(docx_file) styles_info(doc, type = "paragraph")[, 1:6] #>    style_type      style_id    style_name      base_on is_custom is_default #> 1   paragraph        Normal        Normal         <NA>     FALSE       TRUE #> 2   paragraph        Titre1     heading 1       Normal     FALSE      FALSE #> 3   paragraph        Titre2     heading 2       Normal     FALSE      FALSE #> 4   paragraph        Titre3     heading 3       Normal     FALSE      FALSE #> 9   paragraph      centered      centered       Normal      TRUE      FALSE #> 15  paragraph  ImageCaption Image Caption       Normal      TRUE      FALSE #> 16  paragraph  TableCaption Table Caption ImageCaption      TRUE      FALSE #> 18  paragraph           TM1         toc 1       Normal     FALSE      FALSE #> 19  paragraph           TM2         toc 2       Normal     FALSE      FALSE #> 20  paragraph Textedebulles  Balloon Text       Normal     FALSE      FALSE #> 23  paragraph  graphictitle graphic title ImageCaption      TRUE      FALSE #> 24  paragraph    tabletitle   table title TableCaption      TRUE      FALSE styles_info(doc, type = "table")[, 1:6] #>    style_type             style_id          style_name       base_on is_custom #> 6       table        TableauNormal        Normal Table          <NA>     FALSE #> 10      table        tabletemplate      table_template TableauNormal      TRUE #> 11      table  Listeclaire-Accent2 Light List Accent 2 TableauNormal     FALSE #> 17      table Tableauprofessionnel  Table Professional TableauNormal     FALSE #>    is_default #> 6        TRUE #> 10      FALSE #> 11      FALSE #> 17      FALSE styles_info(doc, type = "numbering")[, 1:6] #>   style_type    style_id style_name base_on is_custom is_default #> 7  numbering Aucuneliste    No List    <NA>     FALSE       TRUE

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: following demonstrates pass arguments R Markdown yaml:
code: --- output:   officedown::rdocx_document:     reference_docx: pandoc_template.docx     tables:       style: Table       layout: autofit       width: 1.0       topcaption: true       tab.lp: 'tab:'       caption:         style: Table Caption         pre: 'Table '         sep: ': '         tnd: 0         tns: '-'         fp_text: !expr officer::fp_text_lite(bold = TRUE)       conditional:         first_row: true         first_column: false         last_row: false         last_column: false         no_hband: false         no_vband: true     plots:       style: Normal       align: center       fig.lp: 'fig:'       topcaption: false       caption:         style: Image Caption         pre: 'Figure '         sep: ': '         tnd: 0         tns: '-'         fp_text: !expr officer::fp_text_lite(bold = TRUE)     lists:       ol.style: null       ul.style: null     mapstyles:       Normal: ['First Paragraph', 'Author', 'Date']     page_size:       width: 11906 / 1440       height: 16838 / 1440       orient: "portrait"     page_margins:       bottom: 1       top: 1       right: 1417 / 1440       left: 1417 / 1440       header: 708 / 1440       footer: 708 / 1440       gutter: 0 / 1440     reference_num: true ---

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
text: using knitr::include_graphics() 'rdocx_document', image must local, standard 'R Markdown' output documents, images located Internet supported.

title: Advanced R Markdown Word Format — rdocx_document
code: # rdocx_document basic example ----- library(rmarkdown) library(officedown)  if (pandoc_available() && pandoc_version() >= numeric_version("2.0")) {   # minimal example -----   example <- system.file(     package = "officedown",     "examples/minimal_word.Rmd"   )   rmd_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".Rmd")   file.copy(example, to = rmd_file)    docx_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".docx")   render(rmd_file, output_file = docx_file, quiet = TRUE) }

what: Advanced R Markdown PowerPoint Format — rpptx_document
title: Advanced R Markdown PowerPoint Format — rpptx_document
text: Format converting R Markdown MS PowerPoint document. function allow specify destination chunks output PowerPoint file. case, must specify layout master layout want use, well ph argument, allow specify placeholder generated place result. Use officer package help choose identfiers use. function also support Vector graphics output editable format (using package rvg). Wrap R plot commands function dml use graphic capability.

title: Advanced R Markdown PowerPoint Format — rpptx_document
code: rpptx_document(   base_format = "rmarkdown::powerpoint_presentation",   layout = "Title and Content",   master = "Office Theme",   tcf = list(),   ... )

title: Advanced R Markdown PowerPoint Format — rpptx_document
text: base_format scalar character, format used base document officedown. default powerpoint_presentation can also powerpoint_presentation2 bookdown layout default slide layout name use master default master layout name layout located tcf default conditional formatting settings defined officer::table_conditional_formatting() ... arguments used powerpoint_presentation

title: Advanced R Markdown PowerPoint Format — rpptx_document
text: R Markdown output format pass render

title: Advanced R Markdown PowerPoint Format — rpptx_document
code: library(rmarkdown) run_ok <- pandoc_available() && pandoc_version() > numeric_version("2.4")  if(run_ok){   example <- system.file(package = "officedown",     "examples/minimal_powerpoint.Rmd")   rmd_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".Rmd")   file.copy(example, to = rmd_file)    pptx_file_1 <- tempfile(fileext = ".pptx")   render(rmd_file, output_file = pptx_file_1) } #>  #>  #> processing file: file1fc279eaa607.Rmd #> 1/14                   #> 2/14 [setup]           #> 3/14                   #> 4/14 [unnamed-chunk-1] #> 5/14                   #> 6/14 [unnamed-chunk-2] #> 7/14                   #> 8/14 [plot1]           #> 9/14                   #> 10/14 [unnamed-chunk-3] #> 11/14                   #> 12/14 [unnamed-chunk-4] #> 13/14                   #> 14/14 [unnamed-chunk-5] #> output file: file1fc279eaa607.knit.md #> /opt/hostedtoolcache/pandoc/3.1.11/x64/pandoc +RTS -K512m -RTS file1fc279eaa607.knit.md --to pptx --from markdown+autolink_bare_uris+tex_math_single_backslash --output /tmp/RtmpNiKGlz/file1fc268fbc429.pptx --reference-doc /tmp/RtmpNiKGlz/file1fc2e48d3b3.pptx  #>  #> Output created: /tmp/RtmpNiKGlz/file1fc268fbc429.pptx

title: officedown 0.3.0
text: data.frame Word now support chunk options tab.alt.title tab.alt.description, used alternative text tables. Document sections set NULL default. PowerPoint support fpar() block_list().

title: officedown 0.3.0
text: fix usage bookmark id containing underscore update default values according new default values officer::opts_current_table(). dml background color bg now read R Markdown. require officer >= 0.5.1 avoid page breaking sections

title: officedown 0.3.0
text: simplify/drop code officer 0.4.5 add tests

title: officedown 0.2.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-07

title: officedown 0.2.4
text: emit knitr chunk option is_rdocx_document set TRUE starting rdocx_document. help programing can used detect rdocx_document context .

title: officedown 0.2.4
text: bookmark numbers capture fig.cap.fp_text fig.fp_text topcaption now set TRUE default tables set default officer.

title: officedown 0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-11-16

title: officedown 0.2.3
text: support knitr chunk options tab.topcaption tab.lp. support knitr chunk options tab.cap.tnd, tab.cap.tns tab.cap.fp_text let define prefix auto-number table captions. fig.cap.tnd, fig.cap.tns fig.cap.fp_text plots.

title: officedown 0.2.3
text: fix issue missing Word headers footers.

title: officedown 0.2.2

title: officedown 0.2.2

title: officedown 0.2.2
text: support knitr chunk option fig.alt fig.topcaption.
